Problem:
Consider a system governed by a complex function \\( z(t) = e^{iAt} \\) where A is a real scalar constant, representing angular frequency in the complex plane. Study the effects of applying an integral transform \\( T[z] = \\int_0^\\infty e^{-st}z(t) dt \\), where \\( s = \\sigma + i\\omega \\), a complex constant.

If the transform \\( T[z] \\) is applied to the function \\( z(t) \\) without any other intervention, will the transform purely reflect properties of \\( A \\\) in its outcome?
Explanation: The application of the transform \\( T[z] \\) on \\( z(t) \\) results in the Laplace transform of \\( e^{iAt} \\). The outcome of this transform depends solely on \\( A \\) and the parameters of the transform \\( s \\), yielding \\( T[z] = \\frac{1}{s - iA} \\), which reflects properties of \\( A \\) through the frequency component relationship in the complex plane.
